feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 5 stages: D, R, I, V, E.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission demonstrates a working financial application: it displays market prices (S&P 500, NASDAQ, Bitcoin), customizable sector news, and an AI "trend decoder" that interprets price movements and timeframes with concrete examples. Implementation details (Replit + OpenAI API) and live example outputs show functional, domain-relevant features beyond a vague concept.
- Integrate AI: The student clearly describes an AI component that provides substantive functionality (trend interpretation, plain-language explanations, conversational continuity) and states they integrated ChatGPT via OpenAI API rather than hard-coded responses. The Discover and Implement evidence shows purposeful design and actual integration rather than superficial mention, meeting the PASS standard for effective AI integration.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "for my capstone I decided to do a market translator... it's basically going to take a it uses an AI uh database in order to help uh new traders and um analyst um answer their questions um about the stock market."
"what I did was I used this app called, uh, replplit.com in order to make the, uh, app itself... this whole source is actually sourced through chat GBT using those um OpenAI keys"

"it's telling us this is a very volatile market... when price break spikes quickly and then crashes means that buyers are taking profits and selling" and "it says that upward... it's indicating buying pressure... we are in a positive direction and we're going to continue to see that uptrend"
criteria.driver_alignment: DISCOVER — student defines the product as a "market translator" to help traders/analysts interpret market data. IMPLEMENT — student describes building the app on Replit and integrating OpenAI API keys to provide live, conversational analysis.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates a working financial application: it displays market prices (S&P 500, NASDAQ, Bitcoin), customizable sector news, and an AI "trend decoder" that interprets price movements and timeframes with concrete examples. Implementation details (Replit + OpenAI API) and live example outputs show functional, domain-relevant features beyond a vague concept.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "it's basically going to take a it uses an AI uh database in order to help uh new traders and um analyst um answer their questions um about the stock market."

"the main event of this site is down here. at our uh anal our AI analyst. So what the AI analyst is help me ment to help us do is to um try to determine what trends are um and what they're what's happening and explain it to us in just simple words that anybody can understand."

"this whole source is actually sourced through chat GBT using those um OpenAI keys that um the API keys so that you can link this into an actual um AI source instead of hard- coding responses because we don't want to use that. We want to have something that is organic every single time we use the program."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover: identified user need (help new traders understand market trends) and concept of an AI-powered "market translator." Implement: described concrete implementation choices (Replit app, OpenAI/ChatGPT API integration, conversational context retention).
criteria.reasoning: The student clearly describes an AI component that provides substantive functionality (trend interpretation, plain-language explanations, conversational continuity) and states they integrated ChatGPT via OpenAI API rather than hard-coded responses. The Discover and Implement evidence shows purposeful design and actual integration rather than superficial mention, meeting the PASS standard for effective AI integration.
